first_edition.opus_info: Op. 39, no. 1 (Book 1 no. 1) of Douze quatuors pour deux violons, alto et violoncelle par Luigi Boccherini oeuvre 39
first_edition.address: Boulevard Bonne Nouvelle n° 8 et rue Neuve des Petits Champs n° 13 vis-à-vis le Trésor Public
first_edition.later_copies: c. 1814 with address Propriété de l'Editeur. Enregistré à la Bibliothèque Impériale à Paris. Chez Ignace Pleyel et fils ainé, Boulevard Montmartre

partial_notes: Discussion of Pleyel's misleading publication practices with Boccherini's string quartets Op. 39, including the disloyal procedure of publishing twelve quartets from different periods (1780-1795) under a single opus number without indicating their true chronological order. Includes correspondence between Pleyel and Boccherini, and Fétis's later recognition of the composite nature of the collection. Cross-references to Boccherini's autograph catalogue showing the actual opus numbers and composition dates.
